channel.title: Help integrating smf and server
channel.description: Well, I am currently working on making a 317 server, I want to make it so that people have to signup on the website before they can actually play it. They login to the server with the username and pass that they just created, how would I do this?

item.title: Help integrating smf and server
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:4, topic:339229”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=435610.msg3199310#msg3199310 date=1273168974]

ps, you can always host both your forums and server from home to avoid paying for a vps or a dedi.

And enjoy having a few people on your server…
[/quote]If his source was half decent it would easily hold over 50 players on a low-end server and low-end connection. If it’s some shitty thing that uses loads of memory and bandwidth, it’ll be shit on a vps too.[/quote]We’re talking about private servers here. Obviously they’re bloated pieces of shit. There’s pretty much no “maybe” about it.

item.title: Help integrating smf and server
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If you have little or no knowledge of how MySQL and JDBC work, then you’re asking a massive question here.

You need to store all your character files in the same database that the forums use. After you’ve managed to do this, the rest is pretty easy and we can help you with that.

If you’re using a standard web host, you can’t host the game-server on the same server that runs the web-server, so you will have to connect remotely. This may not be possible if you’re using a free host which doesn’t allow remote MySQL connectivity. If you’re not in a situation which allows you to do this and don’t plan on purchasing anything new, then you might as well give up on this.

Tbh I’m sure I’ve seen loads of tutorials on how to use a database to store characters rather than text files.

ps, you can always host both your forums and server from home to avoid paying for a vps or a dedi.

Read full topic
